sentences.english: He was handsome in a raffish kind of way.
sentences.chinese: 他的帅是一种放荡不羁的帅。

sentences.english: Johnson’s brazenness put him in the crosshairs of the U.S. government.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊的狂妄不羁使他被美国政府盯上了。

sentences.english: A suave charmer, he had a reputation for living fast.
sentences.chinese: 他本人魅力十足，生活放荡不羁。

sentences.english: I have been wild and foolish.
sentences.chinese: 我曾经放荡不羁，愚不可及。

sentences.english: The True Artist The true artist lets himself go.
sentences.chinese: 真正的艺术家狂放不羁。

sentences.english: Uninhibited envy of any absurd dreams of living beings.
sentences.chinese: 任何荒诞不羁羡煞众生的幻梦。

sentences.english: Their fierce passion to remain independent, however, was too often unrestrained.
sentences.chinese: 但是，他们保持独立的强烈热情总是狂放不羁。

sentences.english: Dana was a real swinger in her younger years.
sentences.chinese: 达娜在她年轻的时候是一个完全放荡不羁的人。

sentences.english: Xu Song reflects the unique musical style and uninhibited as the character.
sentences.chinese: 体现了许嵩独当的音乐风格与不羁的性格。

sentences.english: These pleasure-seeking bohemians gave Reich pause.
sentences.chinese: 这样狂放不羁的寻欢作乐让赫希三思。

sentences.english: Again dissolute drift on water unruly, always there is time of homesick.
sentences.chinese: 再放荡不羁的漂泊者，总有想家的时候。

sentences.english: He is vigorous and unrestrained in behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他这个人做事豪放不羁。

sentences.english: Tan Hi "to ride the unruly text, speaking slightly Overlord statecraft."
sentences.chinese: 谭嗣同喜“为驰骋不羁之文，讲霸王经世之略”。

sentences.english: The true artist lets himself go. He is natural.
sentences.chinese: 真正的艺术家狂放不羁，无拘无束。

sentences.english: I have also heard that he leads a dissolute lifestyle, but that is probably just a nasty rumor.
sentences.chinese: 我还听说他生活放荡不羁，但这也许只是恶意的谣言。

sentences.english: He was born with unconventional nature but the traditional value and his conscience prevented its ebullition.
sentences.chinese: 其天性放荡不羁，但传统和良知又使它不能尽情迸发。

definition: confident and at ease/free and easy
to trifle without respect (idiom); to despise worldly conventions/frivolous
